page.title: 18NORTHAW.
page.content: The{Kidston Institute}in Northaw was built in 1902 with money provided by Mrs. John Kidston whose husband had died in 1894. She intended it as a 'social meeting place for men'.It is endowed for Â£1000 which must revert to the Church if it fails. Today it has snooker tables in constant use and there is a very successful Table Tennis section with players of national standard. {Northaw School,}in Vineyards Road,was originally built in 1851, as a National School at a cost of Â£600. Since that date alterations and additions have been made and today it is a Primary School with two teachers. At present buildings are being erected in Church Lane for{sheltered {accomodation}for the elderly by the Welwyn and Hatfield Council.
